member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.HttpsCompressionMode
member.summary: Use to dynamically control response compression for HTTPS requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.HttpsCompressionMode.Default
member.summary: No value has been specified, use the configured defaults.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.HttpsCompressionMode.DoNotCompress
member.summary: Opts out of compression over HTTPS. Enabling compression on HTTPS requests for remotely manipulable content may expose security problems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.HttpsCompressionMode.Compress
member.summary: Opts into compression over HTTPS. Enabling compression on HTTPS requests for remotely manipulable content may expose security problems.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IBadRequestExceptionFeature
member.summary: Provides information about rejected HTTP requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IBadRequestExceptionFeature.Error
member.summary: Synchronously retrieves the exception associated with the rejected HTTP request.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IFormFeature
member.summary: Allows reading the request body as a HTTP form.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IFormFeature.HasFormContentType
member.summary: Indicates if the request has a supported form content-type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IFormFeature.Form
member.summary:
Gets or sets the parsed form.
This API will return a non-null value if the request body was read using or , or if a value was explicitly assigned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IFormFeature.ReadForm
member.summary:
Parses the request body as a form.
If the request body has not been previously read, this API performs a synchronous (blocking) read on the HTTP input stream which may be unsupported or can adversely affect application performance. Consider using instead.
member.returns: The .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IFormFeature.ReadFormAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Parses the request body as a form.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether synchronous IO is allowed for the and

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpConnectionFeature
member.summary: Information regarding the TCP/IP connection carrying the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpConnectionFeature.ConnectionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for the connection the request was received on. This is primarily for diagnostic purposes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpConnectionFeature.RemoteIpAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the IPAddress of the client making the request. Note this may be for a proxy rather than the end user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpConnectionFeature.LocalIpAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the local IPAddress on which the request was received.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpConnectionFeature.RemotePort
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote port of the client making the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpConnectionFeature.LocalPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the local port on which the request was received.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpMaxRequestBodySizeFeature
member.summary: Feature to inspect and modify the maximum request body size for a single request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpMaxRequestBodySizeFeature.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Indicates whether is read-only. If true, this could mean that the request body has already been read from or that was called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpMaxRequestBodySizeFeature.MaxRequestBodySize
member.summary: The maximum allowed size of the current request body in bytes. When set to null, the maximum request body size is unlimited. This cannot be modified after the reading the request body has started. This limit does not affect upgraded connections which are always unlimited.
member.remarks: Defaults to the server's global max request body size limit.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestBodyDetectionFeature
member.summary: Used to indicate if the request can have a body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestBodyDetectionFeature.CanHaveBody
member.summary: Indicates if the request can have a body.
member.remarks:
This returns true when: - It's an HTTP/1.x request with a non-zero Content-Length or a 'Transfer-Encoding: chunked' header. - It's an HTTP/2 request that did not set the END_STREAM flag on the initial headers frame. The final request body length may still be zero for the chunked or HTTP/2 scenarios.
This returns false when: - It's an HTTP/1.x request with no Content-Length or 'Transfer-Encoding: chunked' header, or the Content-Length is 0. - It's an HTTP/1.x request with Connection: Upgrade (e.g. WebSockets). There is no HTTP request body for these requests and no data should be received until after the upgrade. - It's an HTTP/2 request that set END_STREAM on the initial headers frame. When false, the request body should never return data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature
member.summary: Contains the details of a given request. These properties should all be mutable. None of these properties should ever be set to null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.Protocol
member.summary: Gets or set the HTTP-version as defined in RFC 7230. E.g. "HTTP/1.1"

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.Scheme
member.summary:
Gets or set the request uri scheme. E.g. "http" or "https".
Note this value is not included in the original request, it is inferred by checking if the transport used a TLS connection or not.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the request method as defined in RFC 7230. E.g. "GET", "HEAD", "POST", etc..

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.PathBase
member.summary:
Gets or sets the first portion of the request path associated with application root.
The value is un-escaped. The value may be .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.Path
member.summary:
Gets or sets the portion of the request path that identifies the requested resource.
The value is un-escaped. The value may be if contains the full path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.QueryString
member.summary: Gets or sets the query portion of the request-target as defined in RFC 7230. The value may be . If not empty then the leading '?' will be included. The value is in its original form, without un-escaping.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.RawTarget
member.summary:
Gets or sets the request target as it was sent in the HTTP request.
This property contains the raw path and full query, as well as other request targets such as * for OPTIONS requests (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230#section-5.3).
member.remarks: This property is not used internally for routing or authorization decisions. It has not been UrlDecoded and care should be taken in its use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.Headers
member.summary:
Gets or sets headers included in the request, aggregated by header name.
The values are not split or merged across header lines. E.g. The following headers:
HeaderA: value1, value2
HeaderA: value3
Result in Headers["HeaderA"] = { "value1, value2", "value3" }

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestFeature.Body
member.summary:
Gets or sets a representing the request body, if any.
may be used to represent an empty request body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestIdentifierFeature
member.summary: Feature to uniquely identify a request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestIdentifierFeature.TraceIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to uniquely identify a request. This can be used for logging and diagnostics.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestLifetimeFeature
member.summary: Provides access to the HTTP request lifetime operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestLifetimeFeature.RequestAborted
member.summary: A that fires if the request is aborted and the application should cease processing. The token will not fire if the request completes successfully.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestLifetimeFeature.Abort
member.summary: Forcefully aborts the request if it has not already completed. This will result in RequestAborted being triggered.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestTrailersFeature
member.summary: This feature exposes HTTP request trailer headers, either for HTTP/1.1 chunked bodies or HTTP/2 trailing headers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestTrailersFeature.Available
member.summary: Indicates if the are available yet. They may not be available until the request body is fully read.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpRequestTrailersFeature.Trailers
member.summary: The trailing headers received. This will throw if returns false. They may not be available until the request body is fully read. If there are no trailers this will return an empty collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResetFeature
member.summary: Used to send reset messages for protocols that support them such as HTTP/2 or HTTP/3.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResetFeature.Reset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Send a reset message with the given error code. The request will be considered aborted.
member.param: The error code to send in the reset message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseBodyFeature
member.summary: An aggregate of the different ways to interact with the response body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseBodyFeature.Stream
member.summary: The for writing the response body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseBodyFeature.Writer
member.summary: A representing the response body, if any.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseBodyFeature.DisableBuffering
member.summary: Opts out of write buffering for the response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseBodyFeature.StartAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Starts the response by calling OnStarting() and making headers unmodifiable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseBodyFeature.SendFileAsync(System.String,System.Int64,System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends the requested file in the response body. A response may include multiple writes.
member.param: The full disk path to the file.
The offset in the file to start at.
The number of bytes to send, or null to send the remainder of the file.
A used to abort the transmission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseBodyFeature.CompleteAsync
member.summary: Flush any remaining response headers, data, or trailers. This may throw if the response is in an invalid state such as a Content-Length mismatch.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature
member.summary: Represents the fields and state of an HTTP response.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the status-code as defined in RFC 7230.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature.ReasonPhrase
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason-phrase as defined in RFC 7230. Note this field is no longer supported by HTTP/2.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature.Headers
member.summary: Gets or sets the response headers to send. Headers with multiple values will be emitted as multiple headers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the for writing the response body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature.HasStarted
member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates if the response has started.
If , the , , and are now immutable, and should no longer be called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature.OnStarting(System.Func{System.Object,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Object)
member.summary:
Registers a callback to be invoked just before the response starts.
This is the last chance to modify the , , or .
member.param: The callback to invoke when starting the response.
The state to pass into the callback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseFeature.OnCompleted(System.Func{System.Object,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked after a response has fully completed. This is intended for resource cleanup.
member.param: The callback to invoke after the response has completed.
The state to pass into the callback.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.IHttpResponseTrailersFeature
member.summary:
Provides access to response trailers.
Response trailers allow for additional headers to be sent at the end of an HTTP/1.1 (chunked) or HTTP/2 response. For more details, see RFC7230.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITlsTokenBindingFeature
member.summary: Provides information regarding TLS token binding parameters.
member.remarks: TLS token bindings help mitigate the risk of impersonation by an attacker in the event an authenticated client's bearer tokens are somehow exfiltrated from the client's machine. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-popov-token-binding/ for more information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITlsTokenBindingFeature.GetProvidedTokenBindingId
member.summary: Gets the 'provided' token binding identifier associated with the request.
member.returns: The token binding identifier, or null if the client did not supply a 'provided' token binding or valid proof of possession of the associated private key. The caller should treat this identifier as an opaque blob and should not try to parse it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITlsTokenBindingFeature.GetReferredTokenBindingId
member.summary: Gets the 'referred' token binding identifier associated with the request.
member.returns: The token binding identifier, or null if the client did not supply a 'referred' token binding or valid proof of possession of the associated private key. The caller should treat this identifier as an opaque blob and should not try to parse it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITrackingConsentFeature
member.summary: Used to query, grant, and withdraw user consent regarding the storage of user information related to site activity and functionality.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITrackingConsentFeature.IsConsentNeeded
member.summary: Indicates if consent is required for the given request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITrackingConsentFeature.HasConsent
member.summary: Indicates if consent was given.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITrackingConsentFeature.CanTrack
member.summary: Indicates either if consent has been given or if consent is not required.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITrackingConsentFeature.GrantConsent
member.summary: Grants consent for this request. If the response has not yet started then this will also grant consent for future requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITrackingConsentFeature.WithdrawConsent
member.summary: Withdraws consent for this request. If the response has not yet started then this will also withdraw consent for future requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.ITrackingConsentFeature.CreateConsentCookie
member.summary: Creates a consent cookie for use when granting consent from a javascript client.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to transmit the cookie using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL)--that is, over HTTPS only.
member.returns: true to transmit the cookie only over an SSL connection (HTTPS); otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieOptions.SameSite
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for the SameSite attribute of the cookie. The default value is
member.returns: The representing the enforcement mode of the cookie.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieOptions.HttpOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a cookie is accessible by client-side script.
member.returns: true if a cookie must not be accessible by client-side script; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieOptions.MaxAge
member.summary: Gets or sets the max-age for the cookie.
member.returns: The max-age date and time for the cookie.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieOptions.IsEssential
member.summary: Indicates if this cookie is essential for the application to function correctly. If true then consent policy checks may be bypassed. The default value is false.

The key of the value to get. When this method returns, the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the value parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IQueryCollection
member.summary: Represents the HttpRequest query string collection

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IQueryCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the .
member.returns: The number of elements contained in the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IQueryCollection.Keys
member.summary: Gets an containing the keys of the .
member.returns: An containing the keys of the object that implements .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IQueryCollection.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the contains an element with the specified key.
member.param: The key to locate in the .
member.returns: true if the contains an element with the key; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IQueryCollection.TryGetValue(System.String,Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringValues@)
member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get.

The key of the value to get. When this method returns, the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the value parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the object that implements contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IQueryCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get.
member.returns: The element with the specified key, or StringValues.Empty if the key is not present.
member.remarks: has a different indexer contract than , as it will return StringValues.Empty for missing entries rather than throwing an Exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IRequestCookieCollection
member.summary: Represents the HttpRequest cookie collection

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IRequestCookieCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the .
member.returns: The number of elements contained in the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IRequestCookieCollection.Keys
member.summary: Gets an containing the keys of the .
member.returns: An containing the keys of the object that implements .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IRequestCookieCollection.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the contains an element with the specified key.
member.param: The key to locate in the .
member.returns: true if the contains an element with the key; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IRequestCookieCollection.TryGetValue(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get.

The key of the value to get. When this method returns, the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the value parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the object that implements contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IRequestCookieCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get.
member.returns: The element with the specified key, or null if the key is not present.
member.remarks: has a different indexer contract than , as it will return null for missing entries rather than throwing an Exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IResponseCookies
member.summary: A wrapper for the response Set-Cookie header.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IResponseCookies.Append(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new cookie and value.
member.param: Name of the new cookie.
Value of the new cookie.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IResponseCookies.Append(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieOptions)
member.summary: Add a new cookie.
member.param: Name of the new cookie.
Value of the new cookie.
included in the new cookie setting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IResponseCookies.Append(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String}},Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieOptions)
member.summary: Add elements of specified collection as cookies.
member.param: Key value pair collections whose elements will be added as cookies.
included in new cookie settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IResponseCookies.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an expired cookie.
member.param: Name of the cookie to expire.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IResponseCookies.Delete(System.String,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieOptions)
member.summary: Sets an expired cookie.
member.param: Name of the cookie to expire.
used to discriminate the particular cookie to expire. The and values are especially important.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession
member.summary: Stores user data while the user browses a web application. Session state uses a store maintained by the application to persist data across requests from a client. The session data is backed by a cache and considered ephemeral data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.IsAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether the current session loaded successfully. Accessing this property before the session is loaded will cause it to be loaded inline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.Id
member.summary: A unique identifier for the current session. This is not the same as the session cookie since the cookie lifetime may not be the same as the session entry lifetime in the data store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.Keys
member.summary: Enumerates all the keys, if any.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.LoadAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Load the session from the data store. This may throw if the data store is unavailable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.CommitAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Store the session in the data store. This may throw if the data store is unavailable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.TryGetValue(System.String,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Retrieve the value of the given key, if present.
member.returns: The retrieved value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.Set(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Set the given key and value in the current session. This will throw if the session was not established prior to sending the response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Remove the given key from the session if present.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.ISession.Clear
member.summary: Remove all entries from the current session, if any. The session cookie is not removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.SameSiteMode
member.summary: Used to set the SameSite field on response cookies to indicate if those cookies should be included by the client on future "same-site" or "cross-site" requests. RFC Draft: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-rfc6265bis-03#section-4.1.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.SameSiteMode.Unspecified
member.summary: No SameSite field will be set, the client should follow its default cookie policy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.SameSiteMode.None
member.summary: Indicates the client should disable same-site restrictions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.SameSiteMode.Lax
member.summary: Indicates the client should send the cookie with "same-site" requests, and with "cross-site" top-level navigations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.SameSiteMode.Strict
member.summary: Indicates the client should only send the cookie with "same-site" requests.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.WebSocketAcceptContext
member.summary: A context for negotiating a websocket upgrade.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.WebSocketAcceptContext.SubProtocol
member.summary: Gets or sets the subprotocol being negotiated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.WebSocketAcceptContext.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: The interval to send pong frames. This is a heart-beat that keeps the connection alive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.WebSocketAcceptContext.DangerousEnableCompression
member.summary:
Enables support for the 'permessage-deflate' WebSocket extension.
Be aware that enabling compression over encrypted connections makes the application subject to CRIME/BREACH type attacks. It is strongly advised to turn off compression when sending data containing secrets by specifying when sending such messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.WebSocketAcceptContext.DisableServerContextTakeover
member.summary: Disables server context takeover when using compression. This setting reduces the memory overhead of compression at the cost of a potentially worse compression ratio.
member.remarks: This property does nothing when is false, or when the client does not use compression.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.WebSocketAcceptContext.ServerMaxWindowBits
member.summary: Sets the maximum base-2 logarithm of the LZ77 sliding window size that can be used for compression. This setting reduces the memory overhead of compression at the cost of a potentially worse compression ratio.
member.remarks: This property does nothing when is false, or when the client does not use compression. Valid values are 9 through 15.
